soc.robot

Class MonopolyStrategy

  • java.lang.Object
    • soc.robot.MonopolyStrategy

  • public class MonopolyStrategy
extends java.lang.Object
    Monopoly dev card strategy for a SOCRobotBrain in a game. See decidePlayMonopoly() for details.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected SOCGame game
      Our game
      protected int monopolyChoice
      The resource type we want to monopolize, chosen by decidePlayMonopoly(), such as SOCResourceConstants.CLAY or SOCResourceConstants.SHEEP
      protected SOCPlayer ourPlayerData
      Our SOCRobotBrain's player in game

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      MonopolyStrategy(SOCGame ga, SOCPlayer pl, SOCRobotBrain br)
      Create a MonopolyStrategy for a SOCRobotBrain's player.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods

      Decide whether we should play a monopoly card, and set getMonopolyChoice() if so.

      Get our monopoly choice.

      Directly set our monopoly choice.

    • Constructor Detail

      • MonopolyStrategy

        public MonopolyStrategy(SOCGame ga,
                        SOCPlayer pl,
                        SOCRobotBrain br)
        Create a MonopolyStrategy for a SOCRobotBrain's player.
        Parameters:
        ga - Our game
        pl - Our player data in ga; not null
        br - Robot brain for pl

    • Method Detail

      • getMonopolyChoice

        public int getMonopolyChoice()
        Get our monopoly choice. Valid only after decidePlayMonopoly() returns true, unless the bot's architecture calls setMonopolyChoice(int) directly instead.
        Returns:
        Resource type to monopolize, such as SOCResourceConstants.CLAY or SOCResourceConstants.SHEEP

      • setMonopolyChoice

        public void setMonopolyChoice(int rtype)
        Directly set our monopoly choice. For example, a third-party bot's architecture might have code which determines the best action is monopoly and the resource type to monopolize, instead of using decidePlayMonopoly().
        Parameters:
        rtype - Resource type to monopolize, such as SOCResourceConstants.CLAY or SOCResourceConstants.SHEEP. Not checked for validity.
        Since:
        2.4.50

      • decidePlayMonopoly

        public boolean decidePlayMonopoly()
        Decide whether we should play a monopoly card, and set getMonopolyChoice() if so.

        Decision and chosen resource type are based on which type our player could trade for the most resources (given our player's ports), not on the resources needed for we currently want to build.

        See setMonopolyChoice(int) for another possible approach third-party bots may use.

        Returns:
        True if we should play the card
